ProteinName	Nondiscriminating glutamyl-tRNA synthetase EARS2, mitochondrial (EC 6.1.1.24) (Glutamate--tRNA(Gln) ligase EARS2, mitochondrial) (EC 6.1.1.17) (Glutamyl-tRNA synthetase) (GluRS) (Mitochondrial glutamyl-tRNA synthetase) (mtGluRS)
GeneName	EARS2 KIAA1970
Length	534
Function	Non-discriminating glutamyl-tRNA synthetase that catalyzes aminoacylation of both mitochondrial tRNA(Glu) and tRNA(Gln) and participates in RNA aminoacylation for mitochondrial protein translation (PubMed:19805282). Attachs glutamate to tRNA(Glu) or tRNA(Gln) in a two-step reaction: glutamate is first activated by ATP to form Glu-AMP and then transferred to the acceptor end of tRNA(Glu) or tRNA(Gln) (PubMed:19805282). In vitro, cytoplasmic tRNA(Gln) is slightly glutamylated, but with low activity (PubMed:19805282).
Subcellular Location	Mitochondrion matrix
